==Biography==
==Biography==
===Early life===
===Early life===
â
Spector was born on December 26, 1940 to a [[American middle class#Lower middle class|lower middle class]] [[American Jew|Jewish]] family in the [[Bronx]] in New York City.<ref name=salon>[http://www.salon.com/bc/1998/11/cov_10bc.html Salon Brilliant Careers | Phil Spector<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=a-F4AmTkYgwC&pg=PA19&lpg=PA19&dq=russian+jew+phil+spector&source=web&ots=R88sbaU1S9&sig=qQAMlSFcPM6XXxd3VH4zl_n_yo8 Phil Spector: Out of His Head] by Richard Williams. Published in 1972.</ref> His grandfather [[Immigration to the United States|emigrated]] from Russia. Spector changed his last name from 'Spektor' to 'Spector'. <ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/northernireland/music/story_behind/riverdeep.shtml BBC - Northern Ireland - Music<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> As a child, Spector faced constant schoolyard [[bullying]].<ref name= "times" />
+
Spector was born on December 26, 1939 to a [[American middle class#Lower middle class|lower middle class]] [[American Jew|Jewish]] family in the [[Bronx]] in New York City.<ref name=salon>[http://www.salon.com/bc/1998/11/cov_10bc.html Salon Brilliant Careers | Phil Spector<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=a-F4AmTkYgwC&pg=PA19&lpg=PA19&dq=russian+jew+phil+spector&source=web&ots=R88sbaU1S9&sig=qQAMlSFcPM6XXxd3VH4zl_n_yo8 Phil Spector: Out of His Head] by Richard Williams. Published in 1972.</ref> His grandfather [[Immigration to the United States|emigrated]] from Russia. Spector changed his last name from 'Spektor' to 'Spector'. <ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/northernireland/music/story_behind/riverdeep.shtml BBC - Northern Ireland - Music<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> As a child, Spector faced constant schoolyard [[bullying]].<ref name= "times" />
Following his father's death by [[suicide]] in 1949, Spector and his mother and sister moved to Los Angeles, [[California]] in 1953, where he became involved with music, learning the guitar. At 16, he performed [[Lonnie Donegan]]'s "[[Rock Island Line (song)|Rock Island Line]]", at a talent show at [[Fairfax High School (Los Angeles)|Fairfax High School]].<ref name="billboard">{{cite book
Following his father's death by [[suicide]] in 1949, Spector and his mother and sister moved to Los Angeles, [[California]] in 1953, where he became involved with music, learning the guitar. At 16, he performed [[Lonnie Donegan]]'s "[[Rock Island Line (song)|Rock Island Line]]", at a talent show at [[Fairfax High School (Los Angeles)|Fairfax High School]].<ref name="billboard">{{cite book
Line 192: Line 192:
The case went to the jury March 27, 2009.<ref>http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-spector27-2009mar27,0,4751915.story</ref>
The case went to the jury March 27, 2009.<ref>http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-spector27-2009mar27,0,4751915.story</ref>
â
The court was reconvened at 1:30 p.m. PST on April 13, 2009 after the jury announced it had reached a verdict in the case.
+
The court was reconvened at 1:30 p.m. PST on April 13, 2009 after the jury announced it had reached a verdict in the case. The jury found him guilty of second degree murder. <ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6984082.stm</ref>.
